message:
I'm not sure yet how this works, but I think soon we'll be able to run ASP.NET websites on Linux. I look forward to that day
http://www.hanselman.com/blog/ItsJustASoftwareIssueEdgejsBringsNodeAndNETTogetherOnThreePlatforms.aspx
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message:
im not a .net developer but i heard you may run the .net application under linux using mono project http://www.mono-project.com/
its an apache module i think
I think you can already do that, since now ASP.NET can run on any OWIN server, and there are a few standalone OWIN webservers around :)
من يوم ما إتعرفت على OWIN وتفكيرى راح لنفس النقطة, "  إن فى يوم من الأيام مش هتفرق نوع نظام التشغيل اللى هتشتغل عليه مع ASP.NET ".
actually you can develop C# now on Mac using Xamarin IDE and Mono.
I know a few people who ran asp.net mvc sites on mono (Linux) for quite a while. Way before edge, Roslyn, and Owin. There used to be some blog posts about it

Having followed Edge since early days, I'm very happy it will get the tracksion it deserves now that Hanselman talked about. I had the same feeling when he did the same to Humanizer.  Scott Hanselman is a good man indeed :)
Owin middle ware is Host independent =D

Mohamed Meligy thumbs up on Hanselman is a good man indeed. Just this morning, I read this blog post published today titled "Scott Hanselman Changed my life overnight".
http://uxnoah.blogspot.ca/2014/05/scott-hanselman-changed-my-life.html
I remember another guy showing a graph of traffic to his blog pointing to an obvious sudden rise and naming it "The Hanselman Bump" :D
